messages.body: $ALXN this will have a bidding war. PT $200 per share

$BCRX $SPY  
My target $15-20 by April.  $30-50 by end of 2021.  JMP Investor CC this 12/15 to get more corporate overview. 
  
1) FDA approved for HAE ($485k per year per patient) recently. 
2) 350m funding done. 
3) Japan decision on Orladeyo w/ 20m payment.  Dec/2020  
4) Galidesevir (Covid data).  Dec/2020  
5) FOP data (ultra rare disease).  Dec/2020  
6) JPM CC on Jan/2021 (you never know some deals might happen)  
7) PNH data 1st Q/2021 (the big one now that we got FDA approved)  
8) 4th Q and yearly report on Feb/2021  
9) EU decision on Orladeyo (March/April 2021)  
10) 1st Q results on 5/2021 (we'll see how the launch went on Orladeyo)  
11) Phase 2 start for PNH (factor D) and FOP, along with many phase 1 Factor D on new indications.  Results from phase 2 sometimes in 2022 will determine if we go $100+.   
  
Rare disease companies almost always goes up once they start selling their drugs.  Look at $ALXN on their charts since approval.  Now it is bought by $AZN

links.title: Omeros Corporation - Omeros' Investigational New Drug Application for OMS906 Cleared by FDA
links.description: Paroxysmal Nocturnal Hemoglobinuria Slated as Initial Indication -- SEATTLE--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Aug. 31, 2020-- Omeros Corporation today announced that its Investigational New Drug Application (IND) to begin clinical trials with OMS906 has been cleared by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA).

links.title: Omeros Corporation - Omeros' OMS906 Data Presented at Complement-based Drug Development Summit
links.description: SEATTLE--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Oct. 16, 2020-- Omeros Corporation (Nasdaq: OMER) presented data from its OMS906 program yesterday at the 4 th Complement-based Drug Development Summit. OMS906 is the company's lead human monoclonal antibody targeting mannan-binding lectin-associated serine protease-3 (MASP-3), the key activator of the complement system's alternative pathway.

messages.body:
$BCDA Another move up during lunch?! One to add to watchlist. Today announces that it anticipates data safety monitoring board (DSMB) verbal feedback by the end of December 15, 2020 on interim data from the Company’s pivotal Phase 3 CardiAMP Heart Failure Trial that is currently enrolling nationwide for infusion of BioCardia’s CardiAMP™ autologous cell therapy to the myocardium. The DSMB is then anticipated to provide its written feedback approximately 24 hours later. BioCardia plans to provide an announcement pre-market on December 17, 2020 summnarizing the feedback and outlining the next resulting steps.
